issues_found.description: Package version mismatch: ib_async specified as >=1.0.0 but research verified >=2.1.0
Package version mismatch: river specified as >=0.21.0 but research verified >=0.23.0
Package version mismatch: dash specified as >=2.14.0 but research verified >=3.3.0
Package version mismatch: pandas_market_calendars specified as >=4.3.0 but research verified >=5.2.4
Package version mismatch: numpy specified as >=1.24.0 but research verified >=1.26.0
Missing recommended package dash-bootstrap-components for better UI styling
Dash import pattern missing State import which may be needed for form handling
issues_found.location: Line 179, Dash Real-time Update Pattern section
issues_found.fix_applied: Updated import to include Dash, State in addition to existing imports

critique_summary: Found 7 issues in spec.md, primarily related to outdated package version specifications. The research.json contained verified package versions that were newer than what the spec specified. All 5 core package versions were corrected (ib_async, river, dash, pandas_market_calendars, numpy), dash-bootstrap-components was added as a recommended package, and the Dash import pattern was enhanced. The spec's code patterns, requirements coverage, edge cases, and architectural design were all correct and well-aligned with research findings.
recommendations: Consider adding a note about IB demo account limitations (may have simulated fills, different behavior than live) as mentioned in research unverified_claims section
Consider WebSocket integration for dashboard if high-frequency updates become a performance issue (Interval polling has limitations)
Python GIL may limit true 80% CPU utilization - consider multiprocessing for CPU-bound ML operations if needed
